alert.note: Alert for St.Thomas...St. John.. and Adjacent Islands (Virgin Islands) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued September 17 at 10:35PM AST until further notice by NWS San Juan
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH MONDAY AFTERNOON... The Flood Watch continues for * Portions of Puerto Rico and Virgin Islands, including the following areas, in Puerto Rico, Central Interior, Culebra, Eastern Interior, Mayaguez and Vicinity, North Central, Northeast, Northwest, Ponce and Vicinity, San Juan and Vicinity, Southeast, Southwest, Vieques, and Western Interior. In Virgin Islands, St Croix and St.Thomas...St. John...and Adjacent Islands. * WHEN...Through Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Heavy rainfall is forecast to continue through Monday. The highest rainfall totals are anticipated across eastern and southern Puerto Rico, where amounts of 12 to 16 inches and locally up to 20 inches are possible. Elsewhere, rainfall amounts of up to 5 to 10 inches are anticipated, with locally higher amounts. Several river gauges are showing stage levels reaching flooding concern thresholds, especially the Rio Blanco in Naguabo. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
